columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the company's target debt-equity ratio.

The debt-equity ratio refers to the ratio of the long-term debt and the contribution of the shareholders to the company. This measures what portion of the company's asset is from debt and what portion is from the investors. This can be solved using this formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total flotation cost}&=(\text{Equity flotation rate} \times\text{Equity})\\
&+(\text{Debt flotation rate} \times \text{Debt})
\end{aligned}$$

In the given data, the total flotation cost is $\$2.2$ million. This means that the total funds for this is simply the project cost of $\$35,000,000$ plus the total flotation cost:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total cost}&=\$35,000,000 +\$2,200,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$37,200,000
\end{aligned}$$

The total cost is $\$37,200,000$

Before we solve for the final answer, we can first list down all the given values that are relevant to the formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Flotation cost}&=\$2,200,000\\
\text{Weight of equity}&=7\%\ \text{or}\ 0.07\\
\text{Wweight of debt}&=3\%\ \text{or}\ 0.03\\
\text{Debt}&=\text{D}\\
\text{Equity}&=\$37,200,000 -\text{D}
\end{aligned}$$

Now that we have the values and variables, we can simply substitute these to the formula in Step 2.

$$\begin{aligned}
\$2,200,000&=(0.07\times(\$37,200,000 -\text{D}))\\
&+(0.03 \times D)\\[15 pt]
\$2,200,000&=\$2,604,000-0.07\text{D}+0.03\text{D}\\[15 pt]
0.04\text{D}&=\$404,000\\[15 pt]
\dfrac{0.04\text{D}}{0.04}&=\dfrac{\$404,000}{0.04}\\
\text{D}&=\$10,100,000
\end{aligned}$$

The debt is $\$10,100,000$

Now that we have the value for Debt, we can substitute this to Step 5 to get the value for the equity.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Equity}&=\$37,200,000-\$10,100,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$27,100,000
\end{aligned}$$

The equity is $\$27,100,000$

We can now solve for the debt-equity ratio since we already have the value for the debt and equity. Substituting the values to the formula in Step 3 will give us:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Debt-equity ratio}&=\dfrac{\$10,100,000}{\$27,100,000}\\[15 pt]
&=0.3727
\end{aligned}$$

The debt-equity ratio is $0.3727$ which means that $37.27\%$ of the company's asset is from debt while the remaining $62.73\%$ is from the shareholders
